content:
some high points:

  • Leverage data already present in the EHR to reduce redocumentation
    in the clinical note

  • Support automation of ordering and prior authorization
    processes for medical services and equipment through
    adoption of standardized templates, data elements, and
    real-time standards-based electronic transactions

  • Incentivize adoption of technology which can generate
    and exchange standardized data supporting
    documentation needs for ordering and prior
    authorization processes.

  • there is more
we already have work in place addressing some of these - SDC, US Meds, data mapping work (LIVD, underlying resources), CQM project
but do we need something more focused around documentation templates, and empowering AI to improve this?
@Wayne Kubick @Matt Rahn @Jenni Syed @Danielle Friend @Brett Marquard @Bryn Rhodes
I am still reviewing. The CDS/CQI work groups are meeting during the CDS WG this Wednesday to prepare comments for submission as part of the HL7 response.
Still digesting :) I know some of the prior auth workflow is also part of DaVinci...
